sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1,2,3} and B = {2,3,4}, and let C = {3,4,5}. Calculate ((A △ B) △ C) and (A △ (B △ C)), where △ represents the symmetric difference and × represents the Cartesian product.
